intro: Brongniartia herbacea, commonly known as the slender brongniartia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its herbaceous stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Brongniartia herbacea is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical regions.
